§ 2 Introduction You can label chapter and section titles using {#label} after them, e.g., we can reference Chapter ??. If you do not manually label them, there will be automatic labels anyway, e.g., Chapter 3. Figures and tables with captions will be placed in figure and table environments, respectively. par(mar = c(4, 4, .1, .1)) plot(pressure, type = 'b', pch = 19) 图 2.1: Here is a nice figure! Reference a figure by its code chunk label with the fig: prefix, e.g., see Figure 2.1. Similarly, you can reference tables generated from knitr::kable(), e.g., see Table 2.1. knitr::kable( head(iris, 20), caption = 'Here is a nice table!', booktabs = TRUE ) 表 2.1: Here is a nice table! If a man should challenge me, I would take him kindly and forgivingly by the hand and lead him to a quiet place and kill him.” — Mark Twain int a; Or indent by four spaces1: This text is displayed verbatim / preformatted 3.2 two \[ f(k)={n \choose k}p^k(1-p)^{n-k} \] \[\begin{array}\\ x_{1} & x_{2}\\ x_{3} & x_{4}\\ \end{array} \] \[X=\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2\\ 3 & 4\\ \end{bmatrix}\] \[ \begin{pmatrix} \alpha & \beta\\ \gamma & \delta\\ \end{pmatrix} \] \[ \begin{vmatrix} a & b\\ c & d \\ \end{vmatrix}=ad-bc \] \[\begin{equation} f\left(k\right) = \binom{n}{k} p^k\left(1-p\right)^{n-k} \tag{3.1} \end{equation}\] \[\begin{equation} f\left(k\right) = \binom{n}{k} p^k\left(1-p\right)^{n-k} \tag{3.2} \end{equation}\] \[\begin{equation} f\left(k\right) = \binom{n}{k} p^k\left(1-p\right)^{n-k} \tag{3.3} \end{equation}\] see (3.3) \[\begin{align} \ g(X_{n}) &= g(\theta)+g'({\tilde{\theta}})(X_{n}-\theta) \notag \\ g(X_{n}) &= g(\theta)+g'({\tilde{\theta}})(X_{n}-\theta) \tag{3.4}\\ \sqrt{n}[g(X_{n})-g(\theta)] &= g'\left({\tilde{\theta}}\right) \sqrt{n}[X_{n}-\theta ] \tag{3.5} \end{align}\] \[\begin{equation} \begin{split} \mathrm{Var}(\hat{\beta}) & =\mathrm{Var}((X'X)^{-1}X'y)\\ & =(X'X)^{-1}X'\mathrm{Var}(y)((X'X)^{-1}X')'\\ & =(X'X)^{-1}X'\mathrm{Var}(y)X(X'X)^{-1}\\ & =(X'X)^{-1}X'\sigma^{2}IX(X'X)^{-1}\\ & =(X'X)^{-1}\sigma^{2} \end{split} \tag{3.6} \end{equation}\] \[\begin{equation} \begin{split} a(\hat{\beta}) & =a(s) \\ & = hah\\ \end{split} \tag{3.7} \end{equation}\] 定理 3.1 (Pythagorean theorem) For a right triangle, if \(c\) denotes the length of the hypotenuse and \(a\) and \(b\) denote the lengths of the other two sides, we have \[a^2 + b^2 = c^2\] see 3.1 plot(cars) # a scatterplot 图 3.1: A scatterplot of the data cars using base R graphics. 图 3.2: A figure caption. knitr::kable( list( head(iris[, 1:2], 3), head(mtcars[, 1:3], 5) ), caption = 'A Tale of Two Tables.', booktabs = TRUE ) 表 3.1: A Tale of Two Tables.
